title.narrative: Winterization assistance in Afghanistan (Ghor) and Syria (Lattakia)

description.narrative:
After many years of continued crisis, Afghanistan and Syria remain among the world’s most complex humanitarian emergencies, driven by escalating conflict and devastating natural disasters. Depleted
resilience to cope with the repeated shocks of displacement and conflict/ natural disaster have made it difficult for households to withstand the harsh winter condition, where monthly temperatures can reach as low as -12.1 degrees Celsius. Even under normal circumstances, it is difficult for households to meet their basic needs and their vulnerability is further exasperated by the harsh winter conditions.
Unfortunately, people’s dire situation was already exacerbated by COVID-19 prior to winter. COVID-19 has caused loss of employment, sharp price increase of basic (food) items resulting in a steep rise in acute food insecurity and malnutrition. The insufficient/ inadequate health systems in the countries cannot cope with higher demands in winter because of COVID-19. Women, children, elderly and the (chronically) ill and the disabled are bearing the brunt of the crises in the two countries. Without support, winter will increase their vulnerabilities further.
Because of the protracted humanitarian crises in both countries and recurrent harsh winters, Cordaid Afghanistan and Syria recognized the need for a winterization strategy, incorporated in its humanitarian strategy and delivery of humanitarian assistance in both countries.

The overall objective of the project is to reduce the suffering and improve the living conditions and dignity of most vulnerable people during winter by providing winterization assistance. Additionally, the project aims share experiences between Afghanistan and Syria and to collect recommendations and inform the Cordaid Joint Winterization Strategy 2021-2022.
